intro: Borreria globularioides, commonly known as the globular broom, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Borreria globularioides is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
